Speaker: Businessman
Text: Stop… P-Please… No more… I’m sorry… Sorry!

Speaker: Gangster
Text: When you pick a fight in this town, you’d better pick carefully. Especially when you’re carrying a wad of cash.
[He takes the money out of the guy’s wallet. Leaving the corner, he steps on a newspaper.]
[Newspaper]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Drunk Student
Text: Emi-chan, you can’t bail yet! Besides, you could wave cash around forever and not find a taxi at this hour!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Emi
Text: Oh, hush you! If you really cared, you’d pay my cab fare!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Drunk Student
Text: Aw, why don’t I book us a suite at the Plaza instead? You and me can get it on till the break of dawn! Eh? Eh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Someone is pushing a drunken student.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Drunk Student
Text: What the hell!? That friggin’ hurt, man!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [This someone is our gangster.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Student’s Friend
Text: Yo, get your ass back here!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Seeing the gangster’s face, the eyes of a drunken student’s friends widen in terror.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Drunk Student
Text: Hey, asshole. You gonna just walk away after plowing into me like that? I believe you owe me an apology! Get down on your knees, punk!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Student’s Friend
Text: Yoshio, don’t. Not this guy!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yoshio
Text: Huh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Gangster turns around. His face is stained with blood.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Student’s Friend
Text: Sorry to bother you, sir.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [A man drives up to the gangster in a car with a personal driver.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Hey. How’d it go, huh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: It’s done. Pardon the loose change. I didn’t bring an envelope.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Don’t sweat it. Cash is cash. Spends just fine without an envelope. You Dojima boys work fast. Sure makes my life easier. Anyway. Here’s your cut. Ten percent, as promised.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Thanks.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Also, here’s a little bonus from me. Consider it a gift to commemorate our first job together.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: That isn’t necessary…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Most heavies take half these days. I’ve got you working cut-rate. Getting real yakuza at this price? You’re the one doing me a favor here, trust me.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Still…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Look around you. Other kids your age are waving 10G bills at cabs. A proper yakuza’s got to keep up appearances. Consider it a gift to commemorate our first job together. Here. Take it.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: …Thank you.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Just don’t make my mistake and lend it to an idiot. 300 grand’s a drop in the bucket, sure… But if I don’t collect, it sends the wrong message. Right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I guess so.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Lend money in this town long enough, you learn a thing or two. The world these days… Hardly anyone knows what money’s worth anymore. You may not have book smarts, kid… But knowing the street’ll get you further in life than a fancy degree. Am I right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I really couldn’t say. Will that be all then?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Hey. Why don’t you come work for me, son? A man with your skills could really rake in the cash. And a lot easier than on a yakuza payroll. Every meal a feast, every night an orgy… And that’s just the beginning. Money makes the world go ‘round. It can even buy happiness, if you spend it wisely. It takes a long time to make it as a yakuza. But money’s a good shortcut. Come work for me, and you’ll get places quicker.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Three years ago, I might have taken you up on that offer. But once you’re yakuza… There’s no turning back.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: That’s your answer, then?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I wonder if being a yakuza can lead to a fulfilling life too…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Loan Shark
Text: Heh, beats me. I’ve never been a yakuza. I couldn’t tell you. Well, call me if you change your mind. See ya around.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Loan Shark drives away.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What an asshole… Waste of my time.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (This is where Nishiki said he’d meet me. Guess I beat him here. 724106, huh? That’s code for “Whatcha up to?” …I’m waiting for your slow ass to show up. May as well have a look around and see if I can find him.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yocchan
Text: C’mon, hand over the money. I told you I’d pay you back when I can, didn’t I?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Meek Student
Text: B-But you won’t! Please, just leave me alone.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yocchan
Text: Quit your whining, nerd! Just fork over your wallet!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Meek Student
Text: Please… Somebody help me!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (Running shakedowns on our turf? Somebody needs to set them straight before they try anything really stupid.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kenji-kun
Text: Hey, somebody’s coming.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yocchan
Text: What do you want? This ain’t a show!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kenji-kun
Text: Wait, are you sure he’s not yakuza?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yocchan
Text: So what if he is? He’s our age. If he’s yakuza, he’s probably just an errand boy.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You guys new in town?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yocchan
Text: And what if we are?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: My family runs this part of Kamurocho. If you were regulars, you’d know better than to do anything stupid here.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yocchan
Text: Excuse you!? Where’s a piece of yakuza trash get off lecturing us!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: Well, well… I see it’s still all or nothing with you.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Nishiki.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: You kept me waiting so long I was beginning to think I’d been stood up.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [AKIRA NISHIKIYAMA of the Dojima Family.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: That’s my line. You were so late I had to find a way to kill time.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: You’re picking fights to kill time… Go get a massage. Be an adult for once and do something for your “health.”

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m not interested.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Uptight’s what you are. Let’s get to the drinking then. We’re going all night tonight, right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Sure.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Meek Student
Text: Um… Thank you very much!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Huh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Meek Student
Text: Er, no, I mean… I wanted to say… Thanks for, uh, coming…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Let’s go, Nishiki.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [They leave the alley.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I’ll admit, though, you’re finally starting to look the part. You make a pretty convincing yakuza. You’re done with collections today, right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Good. That should put Kazama-san’s mind at easy a bit.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Heh, dunno about that. But he always knew all I could do is fight. You’re the one who’s good at the dance.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Please. You see the times we’re living in? You’d be crazy not to enjoy all this, bro! Learn to use your head a bit.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Once the new year rolls around, Kazama-san gets out of prison. I’ll try to learn a few new tricks by then.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yeah? How about we start with those rags you’re wearing?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Huh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Try sporting a suit that runs 500 grand for once. Trust me, you’ll see the world in a whole new light.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Fashion’s not my thing. Besides, Kazama-san never wore flashy clothes.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: You do realize he’s the family captain, right? Number two in the whole Dojima operation? You get to that level, you can wear whatever you damn well please. But for the rest of us, “flashy” is part of the business.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: So that fancy new car you bought was just “business”.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yeah, and that fancy lighter of mine, too. Which you still haven’t given back.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You want to play the rich guy, quit being so stingy.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: But you get what I’m saying, right? People see the expensive car, the designer jacket, and the gleam of that little Dojima pin, they pay attention. A yakuza’s only as good as his image.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: If you say so.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I do say so. Take your buddy today. These squeaky-clean idiots, borrowing money just to blow on tits and booze… Nobody in this town gives a crap about substance. What you see is what you get.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Fine, I get it already. Are we going drinking tonight, or are you gonna keep ranting?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Hell yeah, we’re drinking. What say we mix things up, hit Pink Street tonight? I know a nice little spot over there. Let’s go.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [They walk down the street.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: You been trying all these places out? Some are great, some not so much. We gotta know which is which. Be boring, tuck all your money away if you want. But these are fast times we live in, bro. Spend it smart and you can double it overnight. You want in on the next hot tip, though, you’ve gotta get around and keep that antenna up. That’s how you make it big in this city. They tell you its a buffet of college babes, but you get there and it’s hag salad? They say it’s just , then gouge you? All part of the learning experience, my man. I mean, what’s the alternative? You’d go crazy! …What? Look, that was just an example. I’m not talking from personal experience here. Anyway, forget that. Tonight’s my treat! You gotta learn to chill out! Have some fun!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Soon they meet two people fighting. Both very drunk.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: What is this, a fight?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Looks like it.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Come on, you’re in the way!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: Whatser… What’s yer problem, bro? You got a… a problem? We’re in the middle of some… ‘portant business!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Trendy Youth
Text: Hey, old man! Quit talking to those… them! We’re not done here! …Urp!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: Who’s an old man!? You snot-nose little… punk!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Trendy Youth
Text: Who’s a snot… Whatever you said!? (pushes him]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: Gah!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Oof!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: Ohhh, NOW you’ve done it!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Trendy Youth
Text: Yeah? C’mon, grampa… Take yer best shot!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Screw it, they’re completely wasted. It’s not worth the trouble. Let’s take a different road.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: No need. I’ve got a faster way to fix this.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Oh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah. I just need to sober them up a bit… with my fists.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Again? I can’t tell if you’re a sadist or a charity worker.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: What’re you blabbin’ about… Stay outta this!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Trendy Youth
Text: Yeah, butt out, you… butts!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu gives the drunkards some healing punches.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: Huh, wha…? Where am I?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Trendy Youth
Text: What was I doing here? …And who are you?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Sounds like that sobered them up.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Must be your delicate touch.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Trendy Youth
Text: I remember watching music videos at that bar… to talking about which idols we liked… Then we got…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: Yeah, then some smartass started making fun of poor, sweet Shoko-chan, and then… Rgh, my head’s throbbing. I can’t remember past that.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I think you two have had enough for tonight. Go home.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: Y-Yeah. …Owww.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Trendy Youth
Text: Whoa, you okay, mister? Here, I’ll walk you to the train. Take it slow.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Middle-aged Man
Text: Oof, thanks. You’re awful considerate for a kid your age.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [They leave.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: All’s well that ends well. Let’s hit that bar.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: What a waste. A damn shame, I say!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Hm?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: You’ve got a punch like a two-ton gorilla, and you go wasting it on drunks? What do you think that talent was meant for? All that raw fighting prowess!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Look, I just helped a couple of guys work off some alcohol. That’s all.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Yes, that’s the point! That’s the problem! You want to talk alcohol? You’re like taking one swig from a vintage bottle and tossing the rest! Hmm… Going from the look of you, you’re Japanese mafia, yeah?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Something like that.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Yes. Seems like you’re pretty confident in a fight. A real dynamite boy.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You’re calling me “boy“?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Ha ha! Don’t get ruffled now, kid! Compared to me, you’re practically a toddler.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Hey, Kiryu! What’s the holdup, man?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: It’s nothing. Be right there!  Too much booze is bad for you, gramps. Take care.
Action: (No sense wasting time on this drunk. I should just go.)

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Hey, now. Hold up! Wait! I got one piece of advice for you!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: And I’ve got a friend waiting for me. If you’ve got something to say, make it quick.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Oh ho! Out for a night with your main dog? Me and the boys used to really wreck it, back when I was your age. But if you spend all your money playing around, you’ll never get stronger. You gotta invest in yourself!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What, like a gym membership?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Nah, nah. That’s no better than spending it on booze! I’m talking about investing in yourself. Literally.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Literally? What’s that even mean?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Glad you asked, my boy! Here’s a special lecture, just for you.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [He opens his Ability Shop.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: You keep pouring money into yourself and with a little training, that talent of yours will grow in no time! So keep the women and wine on a budget, hear?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Huh. Investing in myself, literally… Never thought of that.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Ha ha! Bet you’re glad you stopped and listened now, eh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah, I guess I am.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yo, KIRYU!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m coming!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: All that serious talk killed my buzz… Time for round two! You have a good night, my boy!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (What a weird old man. What’s his deal?]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Ready to head out? It’s this way. There he is. C’mon, stay close.  Stay classy, Kamurocho…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Ha. Isn’t that part of the draw? This town’s a perfect fit for the newly-minted rich playboys this economy’s churned out. They come thirsty for booze and women, and Kamurocho’s got both in spades.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: When did you start waxing poetic? Not that you’re wrong.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You impressed?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: Nishikiyama-kun!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yo, ladies!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Who are they?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Heh, “college-girl-slash-hostesses,” Madoka-chan and Yui-chan.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yui the Hostess
Text: I’ve been ringing your pager, but you never call me back! When are you coming back to the club?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Tonight. I’ll drop by in a bit.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Madoka the Hostess
Text: You promise?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: What, you don’t trust me?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Madoka the Hostess
Text: Well, I WANT to…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Aw, don’t be like that.  Here, buy yourselves something nice.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yui the Hostess
Text: Yaaay! I trust you with my life!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: These two have got this down…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Madoka the Hostess
Text: Thanks! We’ll see you later.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yui the Hostess
Text: Don’t keep us waiting, Nishikiyama-kun!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [They leave.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: When did you get so popular with the ladies, Nishiki?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Wait, don’t tell me you think I just let those two play me for 40 grand. It’s not like that. Building connections with girls is important.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Oh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I’ll let you in on something. The guys higher up the chain than us in the family? Not very popular with the ladies. One look and anybody with eyes can tell they’re yakuza, and not the fun kind.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah, so?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: So, if you show up with a pack of girls every time the bosses invite you drinking, they remember you. Half the time they give me cash on the spot. If you’re in this business, you’ve gotta claw your way up that ladder using any means possible. Right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah, maybe you’ve got a point.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: All right, this is the place. Hope you’re ready, because I’m not stopping till morning.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [In the bar…]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You come here a lot?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Hm? This makes twice. Why?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You’ve got a personal bottle here. I thought maybe you were a regular.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Looks a lot cooler than sitting around ordering beers, doesn’t it? Helps the staff remember you, too. But mostly I just can’t stand being taken for a bum.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Heh, makes sense. You’re a big, important man with a big, important image to uphold.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: And if you hope to get anywhere in this world, you could stand to follow my lead a little.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: But I guess you’re just not the type, huh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I… I entered this life chasing after Kazama-san. You and I were just a couple of orphans, and he took us in. I’d do anything to repay him, but all I can give is my life.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: You know, maybe you’re fine just the way you are.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Hm?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: You keep pulling your weight under Kazama-san, maybe he’ll bring you with him when he makes it really big. That’s just as legit an approach as mine. Just remember, you’re technically not one of Kazama-san’s boys. You’re in the Dojima Family. Why do you figure the old man didn’t take us on as Kazama Family men? Sure, the Dojima Family’s higher up the pecking order, but still…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Doesn’t matter. I’m sure he had his reasons.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yeah, you’re probably right. Anyway! That’s enough serious talk for one night! Let’s get crazy on some karaoke! C’mon!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Heh. Yeah, okay. I did sign up for anything tonight.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu sings karaoke and gets a high score.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Ha. I never knew you took karaoke so seriously.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Hey, you’re the one who said to get crazy. I was just trying to humor you.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Suuure. And you loved every minute of it. Do you sneak off and practice on the sly? You so do.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Come on, quit busting my balls.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: All that singing worked up an appetite. How about we move this party to the ramen shop?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You’re hungry again? I’m still full, man.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: So? You can watch me eat, then. Tengokuken work for you?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah, all right, fine…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [They go outside.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Ready to head out?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Passerby
Text: Hey, watch out, man!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I ever tell you what a great voice you have? You pick songs like an old man would, though.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Sue me. I don’t know what’s popular now.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Then you gotta learn. Girls like a man who’s living in the current decade, bro.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Heh. That so?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I’ll admit I’m still learning about the male idol scene, though. I just nod along and pretend I know what’s what.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: And you think everybody doesn’t know that?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Maybe. Who needs guy idols anyway? Girls or forget it. Some of these new girls are seriously cute.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Oh yeah? Huh.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yeah. Do some research. It’s worth the time, Watch it become your new obsession. Then you’ll be telling ME who to watch.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Heh, it could happen.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Before long, both of us are gonna be at some concert, screaming along to all the lyrics.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: …That’s a mental image I don’t need.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yeaaah… Here we are. This is the spot.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Hm? Hey, come on. You’ve barely touched that.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I told you I wasn’t hungry. So you buy me an extra large like an ass.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Aw, quit whining. You gonna wuss out?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Newscaster
Text: 11:00 PM last night, the body of a young male was found severely beaten in a quiet corner of Kamurocho. Police are investigating the case as a homicide. We have a breaking update-- Authorities have released the victim’s identity. The deceased was a resident of Tokyo. Taichi Kurihara-san, age 32. Police say Kurihara-san carried debts from several loan companies. Questioning will begin with these leads.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Kiryu, look.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Hm?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: A murder in Kamurocho.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: It’s hardly the first.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: No, wait. Your job last night… You said you roughed him up pretty bad, right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Reporter
Text: Kurihara-san’s body was found here.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: That’s… That’s the place.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Wait, wait… Are you serious!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: It’s not like I beat the guy to death, though.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Reporter
Text: This lot is just a few steps removed… from Kamurocho’s busy, neon-lit streets. Nestled between the tall buildings, this odd, inconspicuous lot feels anything but peaceful. This rare remaining pocket of undeveloped land is where Kurihara-san’s body was discovered.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: It’s him.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Businessman
Text: (in Kiryu’s memories) Please… No more…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: That’s the guy I worked over.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Hold up. You’re SURE that’s him?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: …Yeah.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: The fuck were you thinking!? It was just a collections job!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu’s pager beeping.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Who is it? HQ?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah. They’re already calling me in. I’m gonna go call in.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: You think… It’s gotta be about what they were saying on the news, right? This is bad. You’re obviously screwed, but this also paints a giant target on Kazama-san’s back.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: They’re gonna use this to bring him down.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: How do you figure?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Everybody in the Dojima Family knows it was Kazama-san who brought us in. That means our screw-ups become his responsibility, too.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What? But this was my mistake. He had nothing to do with it.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: That’s not how it works. Murder is a big deal. Everybody with an eye on his position is going to come at this with everything they’ve got. The three Dojima lieutenants, for starters.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Shit…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Rumor has it, it was one of them that sold Kazama-san out to the cops and got him pinched six months back.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Wait, what?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: The gambling hall he was running never stayed in the same place, but then they suddenly get hit with a raid? The only way that happens is if somebody with family info tips them off. And the way I hear it told, it was one of the lieutenants that talked… Kuze.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You really think Kuze sold Kazama-san out to the cops?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Well, it’s not like I’ve got hard proof. But you know Kuze’s been on a power trip ever since the old man got locked up. And where there’s smoke…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Either way, I’ve got no choice but to call them back… Right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yeah… I guess not. All right, you go. I’ll see if I can get some advice.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Thanks.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu goes out.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (I’ve got to call Dojima Family HQ. There should be a pay phone around here…]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [He finds a payphone.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: This is Kiryu. Did somebody page me?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Guy on Phone Duty
Text: Ah, yes! Lieutenant Kuze told me he wanted you to come down to the office right away, Kiryu-san. Actually… the three lieutenants are here waiting for you, Kiryu-san.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Okay. Got it. (Well, I guess I’d better take a taxi to the Dojima Family headquarters.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Taxi Driver
Text: The taxi fare starts at . Where would you like to go?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Take me to the Dojima Family headquarters.
Action: (I need to get to Dojima Family HQ.)

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Taxi Driver
Text: Very well, sir.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu enters the office. Three men in expensive business suits look at their guilty subordinate with enmity. He bows.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: Finally. Kept us waiting long enough. We interrupting important business, eh, Kiryu?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [DAISAKU KUZE. Lieutenant of the Dojima Family, patriarch of the Kenno Clan.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m sorry for the delay, sir.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: You have the lieutenants of the Dojima Family all lined up, taking time out to see you… I assume you know why?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [KEIJI SHIBUSAWA. Lieutenant of the Dojima Family, patriarch of the Shibusawa Family.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: This has to do with the body they found in Kamurocho… doesn’t it?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: So that WAS you. So much for gettin’ in some golf today. Eh, Kuze?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [HIROKI AWANO. Lieutenant of the Dojima Family, patriarch of the Taihei Association.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Daisaku Kuze
Text: We got a call from that loan shark you were collecting for.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: The loan shark…?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Hiroki Awano
Text: President of Toko Credit. You whacked the guy he asked you to handle, right? ‘Course, he was pretty emphatic that it wasn’t his idea.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Keiji Shibusawa
Text: I expect he was surprised as anyone that a pro would screw up this badly over a measly 300 grand. He’s a bottom-feeding leech, but I can sympathize.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Daisaku Kuze
Text: Well, none of that really matters. Whatever your reasons, the issue now is how you make it right for murdering a civilian.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Now just a minute, please. I didn’t--

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Hiroki Awano
Text: Quit your damn whimperin’! Just relax, kid. He may have been a civilian, but the guy was debt-riddled scum. Seven, eight years of eatin’ the government’s shit food and you’ll be out.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You’d have me go to prison?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Hiroki Awano
Text: That should square away this murder business with the cops. That leaves the bigger problem… How we draw attention away from the venue.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Exactly. You really fucked us with this, kid.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What do you mean, the venue?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Don’t be a dumbshit. The place you dumped the body.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Awano
Text: C’mon, Kiryu. Of all the places in town to kill a guy, why do it there, huh? This wouldn’t happen to be a case of Captain Kazama pulling the strings, would it?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Shibusawa

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What strings? And what’s Kazama-san got to do with any of this?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Just answer the goddamn question! (hits coffee table]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Awano
Text: Why’d you pick that lot? You tellin’ me it wasn’t the captain’s orders? Eh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Shibusawa
Text: And where did you get a piece? Did he give you that too?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Piece? What are you talking about? I don’t have a gun!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Awano
Text: In this deep and still playing dumb?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Shibusawa
Text: The body they found was beat to hell, but it was a bullet to the face that ended him. The police haven’t made that public yet, but it’s fact.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Really? Are you sure about that!? Then it wasn’t me that killed him. I roughed him up with my bare hands, and that’s all. That’s the truth!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Shibusawa
Text: If that’s true, it would mean somebody’s set you up here. Is that what you’re saying?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yes, sir. No matter what happened there, I didn’t shoot him.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Shibusawa
Text: So says the accused. And what say we all?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Awano
Text: I think it’s a load of shit, and you’re trying to worm your way out of this. Who the fuck bothers to frame a nobody like you?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Listen, Kiryu. I’m only gonna ask you one more time. Why stir up trouble there of all places?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: That’s what the loan shark told me to do. He said he’d call the mark there so I could teach him a lesson and collect the cash.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Awano
Text: That’s the whole truth?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yes, sir.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Shibusawa
Text: Then it sounds like we’ll need to ask this loan shark a few questions.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Awano
Text: Still, doesn’t change the fact that one of our boys was involved in the killin’. And in that lot, on top of it all. This is gonna have repercussions on that other project.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Awano
Text: What do you think, Kuze?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Only one possible answer.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Awano and Shibusawa leaves the office.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Look on your face says you’re totally lost.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yes, sir.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: That place they found your dead guy in… It’s a complicated spot. The “Empty Lot,” they call it. You rank-and-file kids probably don’t know… But the boss gave a direct order to the three of us Dojima lieutenants. He wants that Empty Lot, by any means necessary.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: An empty lot?!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: That pleasure district’s packed so tight you couldn’t fit a pin through it… save one hole. The boss wants that land. And when the boss says he wants something… It’s our job to make sure he gets it. But, now that patch has become a murder scene. That kind of attention makes it a lot harder for us to make a move on the land. You see our problem now, yeah?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: But what’s that got to do with Kazama-san?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: There’s one other thing about that lot… Whoever delivers it to Dojima gets one hell of a prize for his trouble.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Prize?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Yeah. Kazama’s seat now that he’s gone. Next captain of the Dojima Family. So that little scrap of land is lot more than just an “Empty Lot” to us lieutenants. At first I figured this was Kazama using you to try and make life harder for us… But judging by the look on your face, I get the feeling you had no idea.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Hold on a minute, though. You’re fighting for Kazama-san’s seat? Where does that leave him!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Beats me. But he’s not much of a captain if he’s in prison now, when the family really needs him. Not to mention the sweet little kid he raised went and knocked off a civilian… There’s protocols for that.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: He had nothing to do with that. And besides I didn’t kill the guy!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Tell it to the cops, kid. Not that they’re gonna make time to hear a yakuza out. Turn yourself in by the end of today. And… Leave your little finger behind. You’re yakuza. When you say your goodbyes to the boss, you gotta do it right.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Outside Dojima’s HQ.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (It looks like that loan shark set me up. I don’t know what his game is, but he and I are going to have a talk.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Hey, boy!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Oh, you’re the old guy from last night.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Finally! I’ve been searching for hours.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: For me? …Ugh, you reek of booze. You’re wasted!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Ha ha! This whole town’s one big bar. It was MADE for drinking! Me and Kamoji-kun here have been at it all night.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah, well, glad somebody’s having a good morning…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: You’ve got a face more sour than a lemon. What’s wrong? I can’t promise much, but I’m happy to lend you an ear.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: It’s… I’ve just got a lot going on right now.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Uh huh… Well, all rights Anyway, I had a favor I wanted to ask you.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah? You mentioned you’d been looking for me. Actually, wait. Sorry, but I don’t have time for any of this right now. I’ll see you later.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Thanks, I just need you to talk to a couple guys. They’ll be here real soon. They’ll also be real angry.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Ugh, you’re not even listening… Why should i take care of your problems?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: That’s a great question! Ask them. They’re real eager to talk to you, too!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Oh hey, speak of the devil. Here they are now!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Alright, gramps… Is this the kid?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Yessir! My prize pupil!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m sorry, “pupil“?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: The million-yen loan I gave these two deadbeats is way past due. I need it back, and I ain’t waiting much longer.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Why tell me about it? …Wait, you don’t expect ME to pay, do you?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: That tip I gave you the other day’s worth at least that, no? Besides, the debts of the master are the debts of… y’know, you.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Like hell they are! And since when are you my master, anyway?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: I don’t really give a shit who you are. Just gimme my money, before the big gentleman behind me gets impatient.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bruno

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Bruno here, he’s got a short fuse. Especially for stubborn types. For your own sake, I’d pay up before I got hurt.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Hey, boy?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What now?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: You think you could take big Bruno there in a fight?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: …Couldn’t say for sure. Doesn’t really matter either way, because you’re not going to drag me into your problems.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Oh, so you think he’d beat you.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I didn’t say that! …Look, if you’re trying to bait me, it’s not going to work. It’s your debt, you handle it.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Nyeh, that’s a let-down. Can’t have you getting spooked over a chump like him. He’s bargain-bin muscle. Dime a dozen. Bottom of the bracket.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Bracket? What are you even talking about?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Hey, what’s with all the whispering, boys? Are you paying, or does this get ugly!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I told you, this has got nothing to do with me.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Okay, all right! I’ll pay you the money!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Wise choice.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: I feel terrible, just terrible for all the hassle I caused. Tell you what, why don’t we make it two million?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: You wanna pay me double!? Like I’m gonna buy that! You’re drunk off your ass, old man!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Oh, I’ve got the money. Be happy to give it to you, even. …On one condition.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Yeah, and what’s that?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: You have your tank back there fight us for it. He beats all three of us, the two million’s yours! We win, and we don’t owe you a thing.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Shit, you’re not drunk, you’re crazy! Bruno’s famous around here for busting heads. All three of you could rush him at the same time and he’d snap you like twigs.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Nah, nah! Fight’s gotta be one-on-one. Rules and all. Three against one wouldn’t be fair.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Ha! You want to take him on SOLO!? Well, hell. If you don’t mind me taking the money off your corpse, I’m game. You got yourself a deal!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Well that’s just lovely.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’ll tell you right now I’m not bailing you out. If you don’t want to get hurt, I’d start apologizing now.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kamoji
Text: Okay, I’ll go first then!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Hey, are you even listening!? Are you sure you want to do this?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: He’ll be fine. Just a little workout. You just focus on keeping an eye on the action, boy. Watch Kamoji’s moves.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Seriously?!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Aaand, FIGHT!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kamoji
Text: Let’s do this! Show me what you got!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kamoji beats up Bruno in seconds.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: That’s rad.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kamoji
Text: Huff, whew… I’m tired. Gotta remember to eat before I do this stuff.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Kamoji, was it? What were those moves just now? Actually, forget it. Are you okay? You shouldn’t push yourself like that.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Ha ha, he’s fine! Told you, didn’t l? Big guy didn’t land a single punch on him.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Hey, you in the coat. Homeless dude! Bruno’s barely got a scratch on him. You gonna try to finish the job with those weak-ass punches?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Ah, no. Kamoji-kun, you sit this one out. I’m calling the round as your manager! Let the kid take it from here. You know what to do, don’t you, boy?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Heh… Yeah, all right. I meant it when I said I wouldn’t bail you out, but watching him just put me in the mood for a quick round.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Right, then. On to round two of the two-million yen murder parade! Bruno? Take him!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu defeats Bruno with his new Rush Style.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: What just happened? Bruno barely got a punch in! Just who the hell ARE you?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Name’s Kiryu. Dojima Family. Which family are you guys with?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Whoa, wait, you’re a proper yakuza!? Er, s-sorry, sir! I didn’t know! We just work for Toko Credit.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Well there’s a coincidence. I have business with your boss. Need to meet with him as soon as possible. You know where he is right now?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: The president? I figure he’d be at the office at this hour.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I see. That’s in a building on Taihei Boulevard East, right? I’ll pay him a visit then.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: And that takes care of that little debt of ours, right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Yeah, fine. A deal’s a deal. Bruno here will have to cover the difference. That’s how our kinda debt collection works.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Ha ha! Whew, it’s a tough world, I tell ya.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Thuggish Man
Text: Well, I better get moving. C’mon, Bruno. Pick it up!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [They leave.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Hey, tell me something.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Oh?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Just who are you? Why approach me? What are you after?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Aging Foreigner
Text: Me? Yes, well, people here call me Bacchus. And I came to you because I had an angry thug on my butt!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah, nice of you to dump him on me… Look, if you’re in some trouble, tell me. Maybe I can help. And that goes for him, too. Those weren’t the moves of an amateur. What’s his deal?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: A real steal of a deal, is what it is! He’s got a gig sweeter than honey. Real fascinating to watch. You should go have a look too, boy!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: At Kamoji’s job? But he’s homeless, right? What kind of work does he do?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: He’s a… whatchacallit. A fisting artist!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Whoa… That’s not really my scene.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kamoji
Text: That ain’t it! It’s PUNCHOUT artist.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: Yeah, that! A punchout artist. Heh, slip of the tongue.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: …All right, so what’s a punchout artist?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kamoji
Text: The customer pays a fee, then they get to throw as many punches at me as they like.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I don’t think I follow. This some new S&M thing?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kamoji
Text: Naw, nothing like that! Come on by and watch, if you got questions. I work in the Shichifuku Parking Lot.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: Kamoji-kun here’s got plenty to teach you about fighting, my boy. You’ll kick yourself if you don’t check it out.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: All right, I get the picture. Shichifuku Parking Lot, right? I’ll swing by if I can find the time.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kamoji
Text: It’s Kiryu-san, from the Dojima Family, right? I’ll be waiting! See you soon.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: Well, that takes care of my troubles for today… I suppose I still can’t convince you to take on the world?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: The world? What does that even mean? Are you still trying to recruit me into pro fighting or whatever it was?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: That’s exactly what it was! You got potential most men can’t even dream about! That world champ title could be yours.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Sorry, I’m not some starry-eyed kid who’d fall for that line. If you’re looking to scout somebody, keep looking.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: I’ll tell you one thing, boy. You keep living street fight to street fight, you’ll wind up with a knife ‘tween your ribs in some dark alley. That’s no way to go out. You belong in the light. The spotlight! And I can get you under all the brightest ones. What do you say? You and me versus the world!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: …Yeah, okay. We just met. You’re not gonna change your life around because some old geezer asked you to. I get it. I’ll give up… for now. But that doesn’t mean I’m giving up for good! You got room to grow like a tree. I’ll keep coaching you along the way!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You’ve got skills as a trainer, that much I believe. But I’m really not in a position to be worrying about anybody but myself right now. Sorry. But hey… Maybe I’ll see you around.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Bacchus
Text: All right, my boy. Just steer clear of dark alleys till then, you hear? No knives in those ribs! Or bullets, for that matter!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Are you TRYING to jinx me? …See you later, Bacchus.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Bacchus leaves.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (Apparently the Toko Credit President’s in his office on Taihei Boulevard East. I’ll start there.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (Toko Credit… This is that loan shark’s office. I don’t know what they’re up to… Better go in prepared. All right, I’m going in.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [At the entrance he is met by three thugs with bats.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Looks like you’ve been expecting me. I’m Kazuma Kiryu, of the Dojima Family. I just dropped by to thank the president for trying to frame me.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yakuza
Text: The President has no interest in speaking with you, Kiryu-san.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Well… I guess I’ll have to change his mind by beating you guys half to death.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Yakuza
Text: You alone, against all of us?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah. I’m pretty close to blowing a fuse at this point… So clear a path, you punk-ass trash!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [He keeps his word and beats them half to death. After that, Kiryu goes up on the elevator to the director’s office. He is very scared. There’s a gun in his hands. He aims it at Kiryu.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Toko Credit President
Text: N-No way… How’d you make it here!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: It’s just you and me now, Mr. President. Now we can talk without any interruptions.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Toko Credit President
Text: Talk? About what?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Don’t waste time playing the fool. Why did you set me up? What are you after?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Toko Credit President
Text: Hey, stay where you are! F-Fine! I’ll tell you everything! Just calm down a minute, okay!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Toko Credit President
Text: I don’t know anything about any set-up. I just did what I was told. He said I should have you collect the cash there in that back lot…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: And who was it that told you that?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Toko Credit President
Text: It… It was-- Ah!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Kuze… Sir. No way. It was you?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: What’s that? What are we talking about, Mr. President?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Toko Credit President
Text: N-No idea…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Kiryu, what are you doing? Huh? Pretty sure I told you to turn yourself in, and instead you’re over here doing dumb shit!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [He hits him in the stomach. Kiryu bends in pain.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Hrngh!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Damn, I knew I was getting soft. Back in the day, one punch was enough to straighten out little shits like you. Mr. President, think I could get a little privacy? Gotta give my boy here a little lecture.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Toko Credit President
Text: T-Take as long as you need…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [The president is running away. Kuze gets a cigarette pack, gives one to Kiryu and lights it.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: That’s the good stuff. I’m glad we have this opportunity. I wanted to have a chat with you. No bullshit. You and Nishikiyama… You’re orphans, right? Grew up in Kazama’s joint. Sunflower Orphanage, wasn’t it?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: There’s no shame in being an orphan. It’s rare when a yakuza comes from a normal family. Still… That Kazama’s a cruel son of a bitch.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What do you mean by that?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: He takes in these kids, then he owns them for life. He’s got you and your boy Nishikiyama acting like human shields for him. You’d be willing to give your life for him, wouldn’t you? That’s some brainwashing kind of shit right there.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: And the point is, sir? I’m not seeing where you’re going with all this.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Kiryu… I want you to spy on Kazama for me.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: What?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: I told you about the Empty Lot, right? I get that land, and I’m the next captain. Next in line to lead the Dojima Family. But there’s one piece of information I need in order to get it, and Kazama’s sitting on it.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Information?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Yeah. And I want you to get it out of him. I doubt he’d ever think to suspect you. Pull this off, and I’ll personally guarantee your future in the family.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: The Tojo Clan’s 25,000 men deep, and the Dojima Family is one of the major players in it. Making the upper ranks here is no small accomplishment. As a bonus, I’ll give you the guy who actually murdered your man.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: So it WAS you who set me up.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Maybe, maybe not. But you can be damn sure you’re serving time if you turn this offer down. Join me, or go down with Kazama’s ship. Choice is yours. …But I want your answer right now. Right here.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: …Lieutenant Kuze.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Yeah?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You think you’re smart enough to control the board… But you’re too clumsy to hold the pieces.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: What?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: You don’t know a thing about me, and you sure as hell don’t know Kazama-san.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Cocky little shit! You’re gonna make an enemy of me? You think you’re ready for what that entails!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m ready. If I weren’t, I’d have no business calling myself a yakuza.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [He leaves the building.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (Hm? That’s my beeper. …Don’t recognize the number. It’s not his number, but that’s got to be Nishiki calling. I’ll find a phone and call him back.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Hey, Kiryu? It’s Nishikiyama.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah. I figured it was you trying to get a hold of me. Where are you?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: The Kazama Family office. On Tenkaichi Street.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Kazama’s office? What are you doing there?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I’m talking with Kashiwagi-san right now. I thought he might be able to give us some advice. He’s Kazama-san’s right hand, after all.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Makes sense.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: So how’d it go on your side? You left the Dojima office, right?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah, but there were some complications.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Complications?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’ll tell you when I see you.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Okay. I’ll stay here with Kashiwagi-san at the Kazama office, but get here quick. I think you need to hear what Kashiwagi-san has to say. Have you heard about the Empty Lot?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Kuze told me about it just now. I guess nothing gets past Kashiwagi-san. I’ll be there in a bit. (Better head to the Kazama Family office.]

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (The Kazama Family office… Nishiki should be inside.]

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Yo, Kiryu. You made good time.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m sorry, Kashiwagi-san. I never wanted to make trouble for you like this.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Um, sir…?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Ermgradurohey.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m sorry?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: I’m glad you’re okay. Nishikiyama filled me in up to the point where HQ called you in.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [OSAMU KASHIWAGI. Captain of the Kazama Family, a Dojima Family subsidiary.]

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: I’ve got a pretty good guess what happened after that, too. …Did Kuze approach you? Ask you to sell out Kazama?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah. He did.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Wait, what’s going on!?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: The man who Kiryu allegedly killed in the Empty Lot was shot to death. Of course, I don’t need to tell you he wouldn’t do that. Which means somebody framed him.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Holy shit, that’s a relief! You couldn’t have told me that sooner, sir? This whole time I was thinking my brother actually offed a guy!

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Nishiki.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: This isn’t good, Kiryu. Tell me everything Kuze said, from the beginning.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu retells his conversation with Kuze.]

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: …I see. So the three lieutenants are all jockeying for Kazama’s place while he’s out of the picture in prison.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: That’s crazy. Nobody but Kazama-san could hack it as Dojima captain!

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Calm down, Nishiki. Back to the Empty Lot Kuze mentioned. You boys are only just hearing about it, right?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yes, sir. Kashiwagi-san, do you know more about it?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Yeah. There’s a big redevelopment project in the works involving a chunk of Kamurocho. Dojima’s had those three racing against each other to clear out all the tenants in the area so he can get at the land.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I did hear about that. They’ve been buying up land and buildings owned by a bunch of different people to bundle it all together and resell it for a major profit, right?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Right. But amid all that, there’s one tiny patch of land that nobody can get their hands on.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: And that’s the Empty Lot?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Yeah. They only recently figured it out, though. They bought up 80% of the neighborhood before they found it. And it’s sitting in the dead center of the redevelopment area. If they can’t get that plot, there’s no way they can sell any of what they’ve already bought.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: That’s a hell of a snag… And you say nobody’s managed to make a move on that lot yet?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: The owner’s gone missing. If they turned up now, the price I’ve heard being thrown around is one billion.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: A billion…?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: A billion yen for that tiny lot!?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Sure. That tiny lot could sink the whole redevelopment project, and Dojima’s already sunk ten billion plus into buying up the area. They can’t go back now, even if it means coughing up a billion yen for a postage stamp of land.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Kuze said that Kazama-san had some key piece of info they needed in order to get the land.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: What is it Kazama-san knows?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: I couldn’t say. That’s the first I’ve heard of it.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: But you figure it’s gotta have something to do with the missing owner, right? Well, whatever it is, Kuze set Kiryu up to force him to get that info out of Kazama.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Right. At the cost of somebody’s life…

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: You two realize the situation we’re in, right? Kiryu’s in the crosshairs here, but so is Kazama. They make Kiryu out to have murdered a civilian, and they can demand accountability from Kazama. And, that’s only the beginning. Watch Kuze get the Empty Lot captain. He’ll drive Kazama out of the and become Dojima’s family entirely.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Drive him out?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: No way… You really think they could get him expelled!?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: They’d find a way. And with Kazama in prison now, he can’t stop them.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Kazama-san, expelled…?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: And I’m sure I don’t have to tell you what happens to yakuza after they’ve been cut loose. Getting kicked to the curb after having climbed all the way to the top… Most men don’t survive that humiliation. “Ex-yakuza” is a common phrase in the obituaries for homeless suicides.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: But… Kiryu didn’t actually kill anybody! If we can prove he’s innocent, they can’t use that to get Kazama-san booted!

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: The only way to prove that is to catch the guy who did it.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Right. But whoever it is, he’s in Kuze’s pocket. We can’t make a move against a Dojima lieutenant. Pick a fight with the brass in our world, and you’re finished.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: But if we don’t do something, Kiryu’ll get thrown in jail!

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: If we act, move from it hurts Kazama’s standing even more. One wrong us, and they’ll have their reason to expel him.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: So what, then? What do we do!?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Kashiwagi-san.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Hm?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: My innocence and the Empty Lot can both wait. What matters most to me right now is protecting Kazama-san, and that’s what I’m going to do.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: You have a plan?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yes, sir… I let this happen. I’ll take responsibility for it alone. There’s only one way to keep this from coming back around to Kazama-san.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Take responsibility alone? Just what are you planning, Kiryu?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I… I’ll leave the Dojima Family, effective today. Terminate my oath and retire from the yakuza.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Kiryu, are you serious?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m taking care of this one myself. Once I’m out, I’ll put pressure on Kuze and get him to hand over the killer.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Are you insane? You think they’ll let a yakuza only three years deep in his oath leave in one piece? Worst case, they’ll kill you, man! It hurts to say it, but Kuze’s holding the Dojima Family’s reins right now. And you think you can turn him down and then walk away alive!?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’m not going to ask Kuze, I’m going straight to Dojima! Besides, we don’t know they’ll kill me for sure. Get your car, Nishiki. I’m going to the family headquarters.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Like hell you are! You’re just desperate. This is nuts!

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Shut up! There’s no other way. I’m not going to sit here and let them do this!

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: That’s enough, Kiryu. Nishikiyama is right.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I don’t care who’s right. I’m just a punk kid who only became a yakuza to follow Kazama-san. If my screw-up is going to bring him down… I’m ready to do what I have to.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: Do you even comprehend how serious this is? Huh!? Are you too big to do who you’re told now? Is that it, Kiryu!?

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yes, sir… Even if Kazama-san himself tried to stop me, I’d go.

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kashiwagi
Text: You…  Idiot!

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Please forgive me, Kashiwagi-san. Nishiki… Get the car. Thank you for all you’ve done for me, sir. (bows]

Chapter: Go to the Kazama Family Office
Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: (Nishiki should be waiting with the car. I need to get to Showa Street.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Bro… Just because you say you want out doesn’t mean Kuze’s gonna just let you go. Who knows what’s going to happen in there? Just… be ready.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I am. Let’s go.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: All right. Get in.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [While Kiryu is going to meet with Kuze, he recalls his childhood in an orphanage.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Young Kiryu and Nishikiyama are lying on the ground. They are badly beaten. Kazama stands next to them.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Wh-Why not? Why can’t we, Kazama-san? It’s our lives. Our future. We can decide… I owe you everything, but this isn’t about that. And don’t play the saint. You’re yakuza yourself! Considering that… You have no right to tell us we can’t be yakuza… You’ve got no right!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Kiryu…

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: We’ve looked up to you for all this time. Your car. Your confidence… The way everybody bows to you. We idolized you. I want that life, too. Is that so wrong!? Is that too much…? Do orphans not get to dream!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu is sitting motionless in the Nishikiyama car.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Hey. Whatchya thinking a out?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Nothing… Just spacing out.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Well, I was just thinking… about that time Kazama-san beat the snot out of the both of us. Then the next day… We were yakuza. And if I know you… I’m guessing you’re thinking the same thing.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Figures… It’s scary how good you are at that, bro.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [At the office…]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: I’ve seen this place a million times, but it n as scary as it does now.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Dojima Guard
Text: Evening, gents!

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Is the boss… Is Dojima in today?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Dojima Guard
Text: Yes, sir. He’s inside.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: It’ll be just me from here.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Dojima Guard
Text: Sir?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Please give the boss a message. Tell him… Kazuma Kiryu is here to end his oath.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Dojima Guard
Text: Kiryu-san? Wait, seriously!?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yeah. Thanks, Nishiki. And sorry. You head on back.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: You’re really going through with this, Kiryu?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: I’ll have a talk with the boss. It’s not like I’m a dead man just yet. I’ll try to finesse it, like you would.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Nishikiyama
Text: Shit, now you’ve really got me nervous, you fool.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: See you later, bro.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Text: [Kiryu enters the office full of yakuza. His lieutenant, Daisaku Kuze sitting in his chair near a coffee table.]

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: So, you want out of the family… That why you’re here, Kiryu?

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kiryu
Text: Yes, sir. I came to ask the boss to expel me. Please let me through to see him.

Time/Location: December 9, 1988
Speaker: Kuze
Text: Yeah, that’s a shame. Saturdays at eight’s bad timing. His favorite show’s on TV. If you’ve got something to tell him, you’ll have to tell me instead. The hell?
